db:abstract.db:para: The RotationAnimator type animates the rotation of an Item.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Animator types are different from normal Animation types. When using an Animator, the animation can be run in the render thread and the property value will jump to the end when the animation is complete.
The value of Item::rotation is updated after the animation has finished.
The following snippet shows how to use a RotationAnimator together with a Rectangle item.
It is also possible to use the on keyword to tie the RotationAnimator directly to the rotation property of an Item instance.

db:section.db:title: direction : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the direction of the rotation.

db:td.db:para: (default) Rotate by linearly interpolating between the two numbers. A rotation from 10 to 350 will rotate 340 degrees clockwise.
Rotate clockwise between the two values
Rotate counterclockwise between the two values
Rotate in the direction that produces the shortest animation path. A rotation from 10 to 350 will rotate 20 degrees counterclockwise.
